definition: to listen with respectful attention/(a polite request to sb to speak)/we are all ears
to wash/to bathe/to develop (photo)
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
respectful
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages

sentences.english: Tell me your story, I‘m all ears.
sentences.chinese: 告訴我你的故事，我洗耳恭聽。

sentences.english: Tell me a little more. I'm listening.
sentences.chinese: 請多說點兒，我洗耳恭聽。

sentences.english: She takes all ears to what her mother have said.
sentences.chinese: 是美國常用的俚語，表示“洗耳恭聽”之意。

sentences.english: As you wish to tell me, My dear, I doudt I have any choise in the matter.
sentences.chinese: 既然你那麼想告訴我，親愛的，我只有洗耳恭聽了。

sentences.english: Okay. What do you want to tell me?
sentences.chinese: 好，你想告訴我什麼？洗耳恭聽。

sentences.english: We can talk now, I'm all ears.
sentences.chinese: 可以開始談了，我以洗耳恭聽。

sentences.english: If you have any other advice for me I'm all ears.
sentences.chinese: 如果你還有其他任何的建議，我都願意洗耳恭聽。

sentences.english: I was all ears and soaked every word in like a sponge.
sentences.chinese: 我洗耳恭聽，像海棉一樣吸收了每一個字。

sentences.english: Tell me your news; Im all ears.
sentences.chinese: 把你的新鮮事兒告訴我，我洗耳恭聽。

sentences.english: The cop gave Tommy an impatient look but kept listening.
sentences.chinese: 警察不耐煩地看了湯米一眼，但還是洗耳恭聽。

sentences.english: Valuable information can be yours if you listen to those with experience.
sentences.chinese: 洗耳恭聽有經驗者的建議，你會得到寶貴的信息。

sentences.english: Tell me about your trip, I am all ears.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有不同意見，我將洗耳恭聽。

sentences.english: One must learn to be a good listener to stay in a genuine friendship.
sentences.chinese: 要想保持真正的友誼，必須學會洗耳恭聽。

sentences.english: Really? Tell me about it. I'm all ears.
sentences.chinese: 真的？說說看。我洗耳恭聽。

sentences.english: Jaco: Really? Tell me about it. I’m all ears.
sentences.chinese: 真的？說說看。我洗耳恭聽。

definition: to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
animals
switchboard operator
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
fight to the death/desperate struggle
magnanimous
idle gossip
supplementary cash reserve/private fund/private hoard/slush fund
to prevail upon/to coax
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
to play deaf-mute
